stories.text: What would happen to companies that have Russian location and employees If Russia were to be sanctioned by the U.S.?
stories.title: What Happens with Russians Employees?

stories.text:
It seems I am in some kind of shadow ban, but I just realized it. I am not even sure it's the case, when it started or what was the reason. Never got a hint it could happen. Is there some process to get out of the purgatory, or to check what caused it, or even only a way to confirm it's effectively the case ?

I am asking here just to understand from others experience. And I am just wanting to know what I should know, nothing more ( I don't think it warrants more than that).
stories.title: Ask HN: What should a user know about how HN moderation works in practice?

stories.text:
I had a 100GB BX10 Hetzner storage box for photo backups. I was paying €2.9/month.

Today, I logged into their console and noticed BX10 wasn't listed as an option. The lowest config now is a 1TB BX11 for the same €2.9/month.

Just changed the storage option to BX11 and now I have 10x the capacity for the same price! Had I not noticed, Hetzner would have kept me on a 100GB box for that price.

If anyone here is using that service, check if an unexpected capacity upgrade is available to you.
stories.title: Tell HN: I got 10x Hetzner storage at the same price

stories.text:
Having just recovered from COVID got me thinking: how do I make sure, that my family can continue using all the systems I have set up and am currently maintaining for them? How do I hand over my digital presence (the one that matters) to them so they can decide what to do with it in case of inevitable event of discontinuity of my life some day even when I don’t expect it to happen any time soon.

Having a software engineering background and curiosity to trying things out, I have, over the years set up several systems partly hosted by myself, or in the cloud, for myself and the family. Custom domain name for email, hosting for some family, home network with backed up storage, etc. I realised that no one besides me knows how it all works - and I think it would be unfair to expect them to learn it.

I am thinking to simplify it drastically now, but then many things seem to cost a ton if I let it all be managed by service providers for each family member.
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you plan passing on maintenance for your digital self?

SmartWater: The forensic spray helping keep women safe

stories.text: Was thinking yesterday that typing `yes` in most terminals produces an endless loop of y-s printed on the screen which has it's purpose, but might be very confusing to a newcomer. Do you guys think terminals have a good UX in general ? Any other examples of hilariously unintuitive behavior ?
stories.title: Ask HN: Does the Unix terminal have good UX?
